column2: At least 13 people were injured, three seriously, after a mezzanine floor collapsed at an east London pub on Saturday afternoon, February 12, emergency services said. The London Ambulance Service said it was called to a “major incident” at Roach Road, Hackney Wick at 4:44 pm on Saturday. The ambulance service said it treated 13 people on the scene and took four people to nearby hospitals. Footage by Harriet McMahon shows people within the rubble at the Two More Years bar. Credit: Harriet McMahon via Storyful
column4: Several Injured as Mezzanine Floor at East London Pub Collapses
